author: {'steamid': '76561198137804174', 'num_games_owned': 381, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 507, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 507, 'last_played': 1579649006}
review:
Completed as of writing this review: 100%

One of the best games from my childhood. That's basically a platformer but without jumping. Perhaps it's nostalgia glasses but I really like almost anything in this game! The only problem is collecting all boxes can be a chore if you miss even one in a section throughout the stage. However the game is usually a basic puzzle and the mini-game moments are also fine (my favorite being the high speed stages). That's basically a movie in the whole package, since the cutscenes capture the mood really well! One of three gems, made by Asobo Studio (other being Garfield 2 and Ratatouille, the latter for some reason not released in Steam)! Definitely worth playing to everybody who likes easy to master games!

author: {'steamid': '76561198066658100', 'num_games_owned': 205, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 241, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 241, 'last_played': 1707513954}
review:
A la base mon Pixar pr√©f√©r√©, mes parents m'ont gentiment offert ce jeu,  jeu que j'ai re√ßu sur ma PS2. Dans mes souvenirs, j'aimais beaucoup ce jeu. La question que je me suis pos√© est la suivante: l'est-il toujours aujourd'hui ?

J'√©tais satisfait de savoir que la version Steam de WALL E est la m√™me que j'avais sur ma PS2. J'allais pouvoir confronter ma perception du JV actuel avec mes souvenirs d'enfant de neuf ans. 

D√©ja pour un jeu sorti en 2008, le jeu est graphiquement MOCHE. Ce jeu avait d√©ja sept ans de retard lors de sa sortie. Apr√®s je ne dis pas, certains textures sont plut√¥t belles comme celles qui composent WALL E, par exemple, mais sinon ce n'est vraiment pas beau. Le comble, c'est que les cin√©matiques du jeu (il y en a pas mal au passage) sont encore plus laides que le jeu en lui-m√™me. En effet, c'est de la bonne 240p voir 360p grand maximum pour les cin√©matiques. Moche, pour un jeu qui est une adaptation d'un film d'animation. Que ce soit les effets de fum√©e, de lasers ou d'explosions, ils ne sont pas jolis. Il y a m√™me des situations o√π il n'y avait pas d'effet du tout, comme exploser un gros cube √† l'aide d'un autre robot: le robot fait son animation d'attaque et le cube disparait, sans effet et sans bruit.
Pour ce qui est de la direction artistique, il n'y a pas grand chose √† dire, car cela reprend strictement l'√©sth√©tique du film. Il n'y a pas eu de volont√© de faire plus que ce que le film propose. 

Pour ce qui est de la jouabilit√©, elle est basique, voir trop simple: un bouton pour sauter, un bouton pour int√©ragir, un bouton pour transformer WALL E en mode Bo√Æte, ce qui lui permet de glisser ou de passer certains endroits assez exigus. Un bouton pour tirer un laser et enfin un bouton musique, qui permet d'attirer d'autres robots, et qui permettent souvent de d√©bloquer un passage.
Il existe aussi une barre de vitesse: dans certaines zones, il faudra prendre de l'√©lan afin de sauter sur de grandes distances, et pour cela, il faut utiliser une rembarde de skate ou une grosse pente pour en profiter. Il y a √©galement la m√©canique du cube: comme dans le film, WALL E peut fabriquer √† partir des tas de d√©tritus qu'il trouve, √ßa se fait automatiquement quand on passe le personnage sur une pile de d√©chets, et une fois compact√©, WALL E prend le cube, pr√™t √† le lancer sur un interrupteur ou sur un ennemi.
Parlons rapidement des combats: il n'y a qu'un seul type d'ennemis (les Stewards) et ils ne sont pas tr√®s palpitant( les combats, hein): en effet, il suffit juste de foncer sur les ennemis en mode Cube pour les √©liminer d'un seul coup. 
Il y a beaucoup de phases de jeux diff√©rentes: que ce soit de l'exploration avec un peu de plateforme, des sortes de courses, afin d'√©chapper √† une temp√™te de sable par exemple,des phases o√π on va jouer E.V.E, ou encore des phases o√π il faut traverser une route en esquivant les obstacles qui arrive des c√¥t√©s.
Dans chaque niveau, il y aura des Art√©facts √† trouver (Ce sont objets d'un ancien temps par rapport √† Wall E (jumelles, parapluie)), ce qui fait qu'il utilise ses objets d'une fa√ßon d√©tourn√© voir comique √† l'aide d'une animation en jeu. Mais il y aura aussi des caisses √† casser dans les diff√©rents niveaux, ces derni√®res, une fois cass√©, nous redonne de l'√©nergie (sant√© de WALL E)et de la batterie pour notre laser. A la fin de chaque niveau, on gagne des points et selon si on a cass√© toutes les boites et d√©couvert tous les art√©facts du niveau, on gagne plus de points. Ces points permettent de d√©bloquer des codes de triches ou encore des minijeux. Ces derniers peuvent √™tre jou√© de 2 √† 4 joueurs et il s'agit de phases de jeu d√©j√† vu dans le mode solo, comme des courses par exemple.
Pour terminer sur le gameplay, il y a beaucoup de porte √† d√©verouiller. Et pour d√©bloquer ces portes, il y a toujours un mini jeu de m√©morisation √† faire: ils sont vari√©s mais ralentissent √©norm√©ment le rythme du jeu, en plus d'√™tre ultra r√©p√©titif et tr√®s chiant √† la longue.

Le jeu reprend l'histoire du film, j'ai rien √† dire dessus.

Pareil pour le travail sonore qui reprend celui du film, donc rien √† redire.

Il y aussi de l'humour que ce soit dans les d√©couvertes des art√©facts, diff√©rentes situations dans l'histoire qui font que, ou encore les game over qui sont assez marrants au d√©but. C'est de l'humour assez enfantin et mignon, mais qui fonctionne sur la plupart des gens.

WALL E est un super film, mais pas un bon jeu. Ce jeu est fait pour un public tr√®s jeune, mais de l'√©poque. Aujourd'hui, il n'en vaut juste pas la peine: techniquement √† la ramasse, m√™me pour l'√©poque, gameplay pas int√©ressant, histoire connu. WALL E est une relique du pass√©. Il restera un jeu de mon enfance, mais jamais je le conseillerai aujourd'hui, m√™me pour les fans du film.

review: The game is surprisingly good for being a licensed kid`s game. Though the missions can feel too long and boring sometimes and made me wish that I could be playing a better game, the overall experience is pretty good. Also, this last part is not that important and it`s mostly a warning for people that will buy this game for the same reason I did, but when I bought this game, I thought it was a pc port of the Wall-E game on the Xbox. It is not.

review: The positive reviews are almost definitely from nostalgia (but I get it). I thought it would be OK, but how character movement feels really awkward especially during jumps/ramps. Also, like any video game adaptation, they change the story so much it's barely recognisable. I understand that has to happen, but the pacing is bad, and the shifts in tone are nonsensical. If you don't have nostalgia for this game, I wouldn't recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198177914742', 'num_games_owned': 100, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 239, 'last_played': 1685327348}
review:
When I was about 10 years old I somehow managed to break one of my Wall-E saves [PSP] on the level where you follow Eve around for the first time, where Eve would have busted animations and sometimes the map triggers wouldn't work. Within this buggy save I had found a way to go out of bounds on the map, thus sparking a passion that I'd carry into my adult years. 
I literally only bought this game just to re-live a childhood dream of breaking my game again. I was able to achieve that this year and get some amazing screenshots of it.
That's a decade-long dream come true.

The port kind of sucks tho rip

author: {'steamid': '76561198233934876', 'num_games_owned': 564, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 259, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 259, 'last_played': 1701320237}
review:
Hoy tuve bastante m√°s tiempo libre y he decidido jugar uno de los juegos de mi infancia, WALL¬∑E!! y fue una experiencia muy bonita, recuerdo que mi play 2 no tenia mucho espacio en la memory card por lo que siempre que jugaba este juego, tenia que empezar de cero. la primera hora de juego me la se de memoria aun con el pasar de los a√±os, y finalmente poder terminarlo al 100% fue algo muy especial, amo los plataformas 3D con todo mi coraz√≥n, y este juego es un ejemplo bastante decente de uno simple pero divertido, Wall-e se controla genial y los niveles aunque repetitivos, son entretenidos y est√°n bien pensados, tambi√©n es una representaci√≥n bastante fiel de la pel√≠cula, a pesar de tener varias incongruencias y ser notablemente m√°s simple (cosa que era de esperarse)

Siendo ya bastante tarde veo dif√≠cil que esto pase, pero me encantar√≠a ver mas juegos de pel√≠culas licenciadas en steam, como el juego de Ratatouille o el de Bee Movie o el de los simpsons!! uno solo puede so√±ar.

author: {'steamid': '76561198880342529', 'num_games_owned': 71, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 247, 'last_played': 1700964718}
review:
Ever since as a kid I remember seeing a YouTube gameplay on this game as a little kid and I wanted to play this so badly but never got the chance. 15 years later I finally played this and it‚Äôs a great game.

STORY 

story is kinda the same and stays faithful to the movie except the beginning and instead of walle getting injured in the junk yard EVE did(well that was supposed to be the scene in the movie but they decided to switch it around.

GAMEPLAY

Gameplay is very short (4hrs). You play as WALL¬∑E in some stages and EVE in others (mostly wall-e) .I had fun with the puzzles and the high speed runs. Game was easy to finish.

GRAPHICS

The graphics had NOT aged well it is an old game after all. cutscenes can‚Äôt be upscaled unfortunately.

SOUNDTRACK

Soundtrack is ok. For some reason they keep on reusing the same soundtracks so it got repetitive. 

PERFORMANCE 

Despite the game being old it still runs good on modern hardware. I was running 4K max settings and was getting 240-400 fps on game. Ran into no issues 

SUMMARY 

Is the game worth the buy for $20? For that price no. I got a steam key for 5 dollars and in my opinion that is how the game should be priced for being very outdated. Is the game fun? Yes I had a good time with this game and experiencing the nostalgia. My overall rating for this game is 6.9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198959711111', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 314, 'last_played': 1696818030}
review: A video game from a simpler time that still holds up for a fun experience. It is based on the criminally underrated WALL-E, so if you know the movie you know what to expect here, and it is expanded on a bit more too. A good, positive experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198195964729', 'num_games_owned': 51, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 298, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 298, 'last_played': 1688151612}
review:
WALL-E √© bem mais complicado do que eu imaginava. Mesmo sendo de crian√ßa, tem puzzles que voc√™ precisa prestar um pouco de aten√ß√£o para faze-l√≥. 

Sobre a hist√≥ria, voc√™ consegue zerar ele em umas 2h/3h de gameplay, e ainda tem o epilogo e depois os mini-games, podendo jogar sozinho ou em grupo de at√© 4 pessoas. 

Os colecion√°veis, s√£o muito engra√ßados. S√£o itens aleat√≥rios do dia a dia, que o WALL-E descobre e interage de maneira super fofa e engra√ßada. Vale muito a pena ficar de olho neles durantes as miss√µes. 

O combate √© divertido e f√°cil de entender, mas n√£o se engane que √© rid√≠culo. Tem certos inimigos, que jogam objetos que te matam em um √∫nico dano. J√° pro final, tem uma fase que mais complicada de se derrotar os inimigos mas nada imposs√≠vel.

No geral, WALL-E √© um jogo leve que entret√™m principalmente aqueles que gostam da hist√≥ria e dos personagens do filme, al√©m de preencher algumas pontas soltas deixadas na trama original do filme.

review: I have been playing this game since 2011 on my ps2. I recently bought it on Steam because our television does not support old ps2 output and input connections. Nostalgia kicks in by the moment you start playing and listening to the old music of the game. Such a great adventure game for all ages. I recommend it to all the people who want to experience the world of WALL-E and bond with the character's thoughts. Worth every penny!

author: {'steamid': '76561198352946856', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 148, 'last_played': 1690769890}
review:
either very fun or very frustrating. there is no in between.

i bought this game remembering how much i loved playing the game on the Xbox 360 back then. turns out, this and the Wii version are nothing like the 360/PS3 version. i can't even theorize about what happened, they're two entirely different games, and this is the worse one by far. i was either very fond of the action taking place, or very frustrated with the bugs and lack of sense i could make of it.

just play the 360 or PS3 version through emulation instead. much better experience than this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198100649521', 'num_games_owned': 312, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 93, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1690525693}
review:
An absolute masterclass of fiction. The story elements are gorgeous, who could've expected such an emotionally driven story to appear in such a game. The part where Wall-E confronted Eve about the severity of her actions was such an intense moment. Truly a thought provoking piece of media that is unmatched by any modern game.

On top of that, the gameplay is like if you took dark souls and combined it with undertale. It feels so smooth to play, truly an incredible experience from beginning to end.

review:
Les graphismes ont ind√©niablement vieilli, mais le gameplay, s√ªrement pas !

Je conseil ce jeu √† ceux qui veulent offrir un bon jeu √† des enfants ou encore √† des fans de l'univers de Wall-E/Pixar (il y a quelques clins d'oeil aux autres oeuvres Pixar dans ce jeu).

A peu pr√®s une dizaine d'heures de jeu pour terminer l'histoire (d√©fis et objectifs secondaires inclus) 
Mode multijoueur local disponible, compatibilit√© manette (et d'ailleurs, je conseil de jouer √† la manette et non avec la config. Clavier/Souris.). Il se peut qu'il y ait un bug la premi√®re fois que vous essayez de jouer avec la manette. Paniquez pas, red√©marrez juste le jeu.

author: {'steamid': '76561199226141884', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 784, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 342, 'last_played': 1704119921}
review: Es ist wall.e mehr kann man nich sagen einfach geil

author: {'steamid': '76561198141961932', 'num_games_owned': 126, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 480, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 406, 'last_played': 1703297972}
review:
Been playing the PS2 and PSP versions of this game for several years, always thought it was above average quality for a kids game.

So when my friend gifted me the pc version for my birthday, I decided to 100% it  before writing a review. So i did.

Honestly, it holds up pretty well as a game for its age. Sure, it's not an amazing blockbuster title, but for a licenses kids game, many of which where horrible back in the day, it's pretty solid. Never really too difficult, fun levels, Wall-e himself controls very well, etc. Decently designed game over all. Also very easy to run in 2023, so you can easily max out the graphic settings for maximum details on modern pcs without dropping that many frames

Also, unlike the Wii, PS3 and Xbox 360 versions of the game, this is actually a better game to play. Those versions felt way more frustrating then this one

End of the day, if you want a short little game thats reasonable fun, give this a try. Also give this a try if you've only played the Wii/PS3/Xbox 360 versions. This is far better then that.

Justt set decent expectations before going in. It is a low budget kids game from 2008, after all

author: {'steamid': '76561198334822561', 'num_games_owned': 156, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 167, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 124, 'last_played': 1678059889}
review:
Good to know that I still suck at this game just as much as I did when I was a kid.

This is simply a port of the original PS2 (or Xbox) game. I had no idea it existed on Steam until today and picked it up immediately. IIRC, this game came out a bit before movies and whatnot were being used to mass-produce shovelware trash so this is fortunate, as it's a really well done game. If you like the movie and/or are here for nostalgia purposes, definitely pick this up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085577118', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 137, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 137, 'last_played': 1677085224}
review:
I purchased this game with the intention of playing it with my 3+ years' old son. Upon purchase, I played by myself the first 15 minutes, which serve are an introduction to the controls and the game-play, via a series of tests. Then, I played what looked like the first level.

I gave up and requested a refund because I did not like the handling/control of the character (Wall-E) and the need to constantly (and manually) move the camera, in order to get things done in a rather small space.

If this game is meant for younger ages, both character and camera controls should have been much simpler. For everyone else, the game-play is very linear and boring.

In terms of how it looks, the game uses very low resolution bitmaps which means that, even when launched in 4K resolution, it still looks very low res. Asobo Studio could have easily updated it with higher resolution bitmaps, as they're still selling it on Steam.

Overall, this game gave me the impression of a very low-cost production, a game that could have been pulled off by a team of 2-3 people max within 2-3 months worth of effort. I expected more but, then, most games derived from a movie fall short of gamers' expectations, as the publishers' objective is to monetize the movie's reputation and recover the cost of licensing, which works against investing into the quality of the product.

I do not recommend it.

review: The worldbuilding and atmosphere is unironically on par with games such as Half Life 2. The creepy industrially broken setting and graphics combined with the banger soundtrack and fluid platforming make this game go from a typical licensed piece of trash to an actually great experience. Only real complaint is the same with most 3D Sonic games, where the ground control can be clunky when not zooming through at high speeds. 8.5/10 loved it during my childhood, loved it even more as an adult.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960895618', 'num_games_owned': 427, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 403, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 403, 'last_played': 1676777853}
review:
Fun and simple game from a time when that is all that mattered.

Bought it on special and well worth the price for that nostalgic feels.

Loved the movie and it is my number 1 animated film.

P.S I have seen a few negative reviews talking about how bad the graphics are and what do you expect from a 2008 game?? Anyways, I do recommend this game as I enjoyed it!! :)

review: This game is so much fun! It takes me back to the days when I speedran WALL‚Ä¢E on the Wii, but I think this PC version is better. The abilities of WALL‚Ä¢E in this game are more accurate to the movie than the Wii version, but the Wii story is more accurate to the movie. The cheats are so much fun! But the one thing I miss about the Wii version that the PC doesn't have is the ability to play WALL‚Ä¢E and EVE together. Other than that, perfect game! Totally worth 20 bucks! A great adaptation of the best movie ever!

review: An Incredible adventure for a spin off game. Wall-E was definitely a childhood favourite of mine and some relatives also. The game itself although isn't usually the type of game I'd go for, the uniqueness and different play styles you'd have to try in order to pass levels is tuned greatly. I personally enjoyed the game and do recommend this game for old time sake.

author: {'steamid': '76561198877601180', 'num_games_owned': 369, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 394, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 394, 'last_played': 1669439527}
review:
first, i want to say the game is incredibly overpriced  
its a very old game, with old graphics and (very) janky controls

i think the game is lots of fun!
i used to be a huge fan as a kid, and when i found it on steam as an adult i had to play
it mostly lived up to my nostalgia - it was fun, i got to relive the story, and at no point it seemed too easy despite being a kids game, nor too difficult, it was just perfect!

some of the levels are significantly better than others, controls map VERY badly on the keyboard with no way to customize without external software

review: Wall-e is fun to control. I love the way he swerves around the well-built levels even if his jumping never feels quite right. I was surprised to find that it hit all the major story beats of the movie and does it justice. In other words, exactly what a movie tie-in game should.

author: {'steamid': '76561199098088708', 'num_games_owned': 60, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 2762, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 11, 'playtime_at_review': 1180, 'last_played': 1711721508}
review: To be honest: I still think this version is still the best version of this game. The versions for DS, playstation and so on weren't bad but this version of the game has the best level design of all. The animations of the humans may be horrifying and they still haunt me in my dreams but the bots look cool. The level designs look awesome and they're neither too hard, nor too easy. Not to mention the epic soundtracks they used for this game. It was worth buying it to feel the nostalgia this game holds for those who grew up with this franchise!

author: {'steamid': '76561198259849166', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 221, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 207, 'last_played': 1663569980}
review:
Una increible aventura de Wall-e para pasar el tiempo por nostalgia debido a que tenias el juego antes en la playstation pero no un remaster, el mismo simple juego que quieres recordar o tuviste la curiosidad de compralo. Bien recomendado porque sigue la misma idea de la pelicula pero cambia ciertas partes ademas de conocer un poquito mas a Wall-e con las piezas que coleccionas y un epilogo.
Los controles son algo complicados al comienzo y la camara con el mouse no es tan eficiente causando a que no lo uses muy seguido.
Lo volveria a jugar si no fuera por la camara la verdad. 

I would say this is an incredible adventure if you are feeling nostalgic about the game and its really worth it, its not a remaster, of course but it gives you a chance to play again with your little friend Wall-e from the playstation version from the game. Its good to remember the parts from the movies and seeing the little changes that will lead us to same results (Not saying spoilers, find out yourself) 
From my pov, the controllers are really tough at the start but you get the hang of it after a while but the camera sensitivity was one of my main fights in game, was better to slowly move Wall-e to the required direction to be more efficient. 
I wish i could play it again if it wasnt for the camera issues but i could go back if im feeling nostalgic about it.

review:
Ah, dulce infancia; qu√© nostalgia. En mi casa nos encantaba jugar a este juego y sigue siendo igual de entretenido y adorable como lo recordaba <3. Por supuesto ya no me resulta tan dif√≠cil como antes y en unas horas es posible resolverlo, pero no quita que me parezca s√∫per recomendable.
Tiene unos cu√°ntos jueguitos para jugar de a dos, y sobre todo el de las carreras y el de la recogida de plantas son muy buenos! Pod√©s tirarle l√°ser a tu oponente o golpearle para sacarle ventaja jajajaj me encanta xD
Algo que siempre me llam√≥ la atenci√≥n es que cambia en varios puntos la historia de la pel√≠cula; no son detalles que molesten realmente, pero es notable.
WALL-E es de mis pel√≠culas favoritas de la infancia y este juego le hace justicia, capturando la ternura y la esencia de la misma. No ser√° muy largo pero para lo poco que sale (sobre todo si lo agarr√°s de oferta) lo vale completamente!

author: {'steamid': '76561199060600802', 'num_games_owned': 153, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 434, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 367, 'last_played': 1689222715}
review:
Wall E for PC feels so surreal...

Something about exploring a trashed earth and parts of the Axiom have a sense of magic to them. And seeing certain scenes drastically shorten to not be as impactful or given thought. Or even that Garbage Rescue scene being based off the deleted scenes.

It's a fun little platformer with puzzles that are easy to deal with.its just surreal going through this game as an alternative universe where Wall E was not the Wall E we know. He's Sonic the Hedgehog in this game.

No kidding, Wall E for PC is one of the more surreal games (based off a movie) that I played. Good little distraction otherwise. Not a bad movie game.

author: {'steamid': '76561199028316330', 'num_games_owned': 33, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 285, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 267, 'last_played': 1677236735}
review:
Un juego muy infravalorado, aparte de que Wall-e es mi pel√≠cula favorita de Pixar, su juego es tambi√©n muy bueno (quiz√°s no tanto como la peli pero igual es bueno) Si es verdad que algunas cosas no envejecieron bien como algunos modelos de personaje que parecen de Psp, los controles con Eva que son horribles y las cinem√°ticas prerenderizadas que se ven del asco incluso en resoluciones altas. Pero ignorando eso el juego es muy entretenido, los controles de Wall-e responden bien y sus habilidades son muy curiosas como lanzar rallos l√°ser, hacer lo que yo llamo un "turbo-caja xd", adem√°s de que el soundtrack (en especial el de los primeros niveles de tierra) son hermosos y se parecen mucho a los de la p√©licula, adem√°s de que si eres streamer y te preocupa que te metan coppyright o cosas asi pues no te preocupes porque todas son libres de derechos de autor. En conclusi√≥n un muy buen juego bastante infravalorado solo por ser un juego basado en una pel√≠cula para ni√±os 8/10.
P.D: recomiendo jugar las versiones de Ps2 Y PC ya que la de Psp tiene muy mal apartado gr√°fico adem√°s de que recorta contenido, la de Wii/Ps3/Xbox360 apesar de que es mejor en gr√°ficos, es muy sosa y recorta algunos soundtracks aunque a√±ade unos nuevos, y la de DS no tiene nada que ver con todas estas versiones y solo la recomiendo a los que les gustan los juegos de puzles.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076820255', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 327, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 327, 'last_played': 1651708427}
review:
I'll never forget the day I first played this game. It was after I had seen WALL-E in theatres and fell in love with it. Our family had a PS2 at home for one purpose - Singstar Party. That changed that afternoon after walking home from the theatre when I asked my parents to get me the game after seeing it in HMV. 

I played the game over and over again. I didn't have a memory card, so I could never save my progress. But that didn't matter to me. I loved this game. It perfectly captured everything I loved about the movie - the gritty, atmospheric earth; the bustling melancholy of the Axiom spaceship; the brilliant characters, scenario & message.

It speaks volumes about the state of the industry that for a movie license game to be competent is a very welcome surprise. This version of WALL‚Ä¢E - released on PS2, PSP, PC & Mac isn't just a competent game, it's a brilliant one. Excellent puzzle-platforming gameplay making perfect use of the setpieces shown in the film. Solid, hillarious cutscenes that keep you up with the plot. Fun side modes, mini-games and alternate sequences that break up the gameplay. Any shortcomings in lack of polish - and let's be clear, this is a flawed game in many areas - are more than made up for by its creativity. It's well rounded, fun & clever - qualities which even in 2022 you don't see very often.

Over a decade on, I wonder if any Heavy Iron Studios / Asobo Games employees - now the makers of nothing less than the world-renoun Microsoft Flight Simulator - still read these reviews. If they do, hear this: Thank you so, so much for bothering when you didn't need to. Your passion for this world and this game to create a quality product was not fruitless in the end. Playing this game again was a dose of nostalgia, and a reminder to appreciate the forgotten people who make games like this thanklessly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198302803735', 'num_games_owned': 115, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1147, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 618, 'last_played': 1710541335}
review:
This game was genuinely part of my childhood. My dad got me the DVD-based one when I was maybe only 4 or so, and I played it to death. Like literally. I killed the disc. Luckily enough, my dad is a smart man, and bought 3, seeing as 4-year olds and DVD's don't particularly mix well. I actually still have the OG DVD to this day, and as long as you have a good enough DVD-drive in your PC, then it actually still runs fine. I've also got the second one on the shelf next to me, not in much better of condition, as I was still young, but it works fine in the vast majority of DVD-drives. The third one is actually packed away in a storage box, out in my garage, never opened. Still sealed and all. I almost opened it a couple of years ago, but decided against it, as it's a genuine part of my childhood, and I wanted to preserve it. There were always some issues that I had with it ever since the day that I got it. 2 to be precise. 1: It was a DVD; Fragile and easily scratched. Even at the age of 4 I knew that they were incredibly weak and frail. 2: You, *had*, to have the disc in to play the stinkin' game. No arguing. I never understood why as a young child, all that I knew was that it was Very, very, *VERY*, annoying. Then, a couple of years ago, all of my problems were instantly solved. The game was on steam. I had wanted to get it for awhile up until this point, but I figured that seeing as I already had the game on DVD, it wouldn't really do me much good to purchase it digitally. Oooooh boy was I wrong. I just recently purchased it a couple days ago for the full $20 asking price, even though it was gonna be going for $4 in just a few days, and I do not regret it. Not only do I think that the game is worth the full-fledged $20, (whether that be more from bias or not, I do not know :P), the convenience of having it digitally is just spectacular. It's so much easier to just download it really quick, NOT have to put in the disk, and to just play it. Digressing, I stand by the fact that it's still a really fun, super great game, even at 16 years old where I should probably start to like guns or something like that. Buy it if you don't have it. Play it to death if you haven't already.

Sorry for the English essay, but thank you for listening to my Ted Talk,
Good night.

-Grey man :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198211724679', 'num_games_owned': 140, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 330, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 261, 'last_played': 1708541655}
review:
Um cl√°ssico do PS2!

[Analise]
Recomendo fortemente a quem jogou jogar novamente,
ele possui uma novidade comparada a sua vers√£o de PS2 o jogo √© totalmente dublado/legendado por mais que o jogo n√£o tenha tantas falas isso pra sua √©poca 2008 √© algo incr√≠vel, eu s√≥ tinha jogado em espanhol no PS2!

Por√©m apenas recomendo comprar em promo√ß√£o, o jogo n√£o √© longo podendo ser zerado em 3 a 4 horas de gameplay e se for buscar 100% pode adicionar umas 2 horinhas a mais, isso se voc√™ j√° n√£o conseguir pegar todas as caixas e artefatos logo na primeira jogada o que n√£o √© dif√≠cil.

[Controles]
O jogo ele tem total suporte a teclado e mouse por√©m se voc√™ for jogar recomendo usar o controle n√£o h√° nada que v√° te atrapalhar ou travar em fase, eu falo isso por que
tive dificuldades nas fases contra tempo pegar as caixas no meio do caminho √© dif√≠cil no teclado e mouse fora que se for colocar alguma crian√ßa pra jogar ela vai se adaptar e ter bom rendimento no controle.

[Bugs]
Eu tive 2 bugs ao longo da minha gameplay

Primeiro deles foi na fase do estaleiro quando temos que acertar a h√©lice de um navio com cubo de lixo quando pulamos na h√©lice o Wall-e meio que se voc√™ fica parado a h√©lice vai e voc√™ cai no precip√≠cio tipo as plataformas do jogo mineirinho, sendo necess√°rio de movimentar um pouco para n√£o cair.

Segundo bug e eu acho que o mais grave, na axiom alguns comiss√°rios ficavam invis√≠veis e alguns at√© ficavam flutuando no meio do mapa o que atrapalhava muito, eles sumiam e do nada brotavam j√° te dando choque inclusive at√© gravei um v√≠deo abaixo mostrando esse bug.

https://youtu.be/vsCOzj_5a38

[Considera√ß√µes finais]
Um dos melhores jogos j√° feitos na √©poca de Ouro da THQ juntamente com UP altas aventuras, Os incr√≠veis 1 e 2 e Ratatouille que infelizmente nenhum deles est√° dispon√≠vel para compra mas quem jogou sabe o carinho e o amor que era pegar uma tarde ligar o seu v√≠deo game e passar horas e horas jogando essas lindas obras.

review: Wall-E es un juego de plataformas y aventuras que recrea la pel√≠cula. Normalmente los juegos que se basan en pel√≠culas no son muy buenos, pero el videojuego de Wall-E es de las mejores adaptaciones de videojuegos que existen. Tienen una gran cantidad de niveles con muchos coleccionables, galer√≠as de imagenes desbloqueables, una jugabilidad simple pero c√≥moda y con mucha variedad de niveles y situaciones, unos gr√°ficos bastante decentes y una buena banda sonora. Si te gust√≥ mucho la pel√≠cula y te gustan los juegos de aventura/plataforma lo recomiendo bastante. No es el mejor juego de plataformas que existe, pero a√∫n as√≠ es muy competente y bastante divertido.

author: {'steamid': '76561198382528442', 'num_games_owned': 61, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1321, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1711839529}
review:
I previously played this on my PS2 back in 2010 (Age 5) and it was one of the first games I ever played! I have some very good memories from this game, I even invited some friends over to my house to play this game in the Minigames mode! This is in my opinion the best Movie Tie-In game ever and it holds a very special place in my heart. I actually just bought it an hour ago on steam to play it again and I would give this game a 8.8/10 mainly because of the fun times I had with it when I was younger.

Cheers,
L√∫kas √ñrn

Sincerely, aMayesingGamer

review:
[h1]If you watched (and liked) the movie, you should definitely buy this![/h1]
[hr][/hr]
It is a kind of long game which means more fun!
To get access to stuff you first have to do a simple puzzle.
The puzzle is easy and a kid can do it easily
The game also does have [u]checkpoints[/u] (but they don't tell you if you got it)
[b]Overall, it's a fun game and you should buy it!

[b][i]Also, why does this game have the Hentai tag?!?![/i][/b]

review:
I love this Wall-E game. I've first played it on my PSP console before getting this PC version. I was very excited since I've heard that the PC version has more levels and things, than what the PSP version has. And it was very new to play those other levels that I never played before.

Hopefully the developers could release a remastered movie version of this game. So the cutscenes has better quality. But other than that I really enjoyed playing this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198268478031', 'num_games_owned': 152, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1642317317}
review: Picture this. its 2009, you're 7 years old and you're waiting in the apple store while your mom buys a new phone. You find the childrens table with 4 Macs placed about and those ball chairs that are basically the target ball. your mom sits you down and you start to play Disney Pixars WALL-E adventure game. suddenly you gain consciousness and this is the first thing you remember, it pops into memory every now and then as nothing more than a damn bro those were the days. smash cut to 2021 and you're discord watch partying Wall-E and you wonder " i wonder if that game still exists" only to find that it does and its 20$ so you buy a copy and play for about 15 minutes realize that this is the game that peaked humanity and then write a review to share in your nostalgia.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970729447', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 130, 'last_played': 1628372817}
review: I'm usually easy to please and while the game play for this is a little bit novel, the graphics are weak, the story is lame, and the UI is atrociously designed. Bought this for my daughter and I to play together and without committing to hours of of single player, you get one little multiplayer level that is a split-screen racing game. A bit novel, great music, poorly executed game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041918145', 'num_games_owned': 178, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 285, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 285, 'last_played': 1625266798}
review:
If you like the movie, you'll enjoy this game. It's nothing amazing but the controls on Wall-E feel exactly how they should be and they do everything they can to make the most of what Wall-E is capable of.

You find items like he does in the movie, and each one rewards you with a funny little gag. The EVE sections involve you flying through a corridor and there's not much to it but it's fun. 

Beat the game in just about 5 hours. If you want a chill game about one of your favourite films, pick this up (when it's on sale!)

author: {'steamid': '76561198250383832', 'num_games_owned': 25, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 554, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 456, 'last_played': 1699675889}
review: out of all the games in the WALL-E game series, this takes the cake for the best movie game, all of WALL-E's mechanics and movement all feel like his actual mechanics and movement in the movie. I genuinely like the start of the game having to start years before the movie takes place with our WALL-E's life during the process of operation cleanup while the Axioms take off in the background and it being a diagnostic checkup to make sure they're working as intended (even if our WALL-E cheated by copying the one unit in front of him) and then giving us a sandbox in WALL-E's house to settle in with his mechanics and movement. even if some of the mechanics in the game were under used IE the laser, charm bot button, and our long lost friend the Buy N Large laser dispenser, they still added it in because it was part of the movie (the last one i don't think was in the movie but ill let that slide since there were a lot of dumb stuff on the last gen consoles). If you are in the search for a good WALL-E game, I recommend you get this game. despite the glitches and texture problems because of it being very old and the game being targeted towards kids. This game still has those movie parts and good mapping to allow more ideas with the move set given that some of the WALL-E games failed to do. I would also recommend getting this for a discount just to get the feel of it and so if you're not able to refund, it wouldn't be too bad.

author: {'steamid': '76561198189146339', 'num_games_owned': 342, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 51, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1624987665}

(the console i played it on). however if I don't feel like hooking up all of the cables and stuff that come with a PS2 this is a great alternative. As I already stated, this game is a piece of my childhood and I can't wait to finish it again!

author: {'steamid': '76561198998358605', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 256, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 256, 'last_played': 1620847189}
review:
First of all, the game is okay. It may not be an amazing experience, but it is not trash either.
So if I feel that way, why am I not recommending it?

Well, one thing is the length. The game is about 4 - 5 hours long, with the later 5 hours only occuring if you get really really stuck. I finished it in about 4 hours and I gotta say, it was not worth the ~17‚Ç¨ I payed, mainly because there is little to no replay value after you've finished the story.

Another thing is the fact that, no matter how hard people try, movies don't translate well into games. In certain parts of this game you really notice that the game designers stretched the story in weird ways to squezze in the 24 levels this game has, especially in the first third of the game where Wall E is still on earth.

The controls are also a thing I need to talk about. If you don't have a controller, then you are going to have some troubles. It's extremly obvious that the controls were made for a controller and not the PC. I mean, seriously, F for the laser and Z for you're special ability? Those are pretty akward controls. And the sections where you control EVE? They are a nightmare without a controller. 

So, a short summary:
The game is fairly dated and short. But if you have a controller and the game is on sale, I don't see a problem to buy this game. But seriously 16‚Ç¨, (about 20 dollars) is a bit much for a game with 4 hours of levels and as good as no replay value. I recommend watching the movie instead if you're just here for the nostalgia like almost all other reviewers here.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090448941', 'num_games_owned': 304, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 558, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1618115285}
review:
Ich finde Es eine Frechheit von THQ Disney!!
Auf alle Plattformen, wo das Spiel erh√§ltlich ist, gibt es die UNIVERSAL Version mit Deutsch, Englisch, Franz√∂sisch und Spanisch Text und Ton, NUR bei STEAM haut man die Version OHNE Deutsch raus.
Daf√ºr ist es nicht mal die 16,79‚Ç¨ Wert.
Tut mir leid aber ein Spiel das nicht vollkommen gleich auf ALLEN Plattformen ist, ist nicht mal 1 CENT wert!!!

Ich habe Das Spiel zuf√§llig Bei Amazon (In Deutsch) gesehen und dachte mit das ich mir das kaufen muss.
Gesagt getan, habe ich es mir √ºber ein 3.H√§ndler f√ºr rund 1‚Ç¨ gekauft und musste dann beim Nachsehen auf Steam feststellen, dass der Publisher wieder mal Bockmist fabriziert hat.
Seit dem liegt das Spiel nur noch in meiner Steam-Bibliothek rum.

author: {'steamid': '76561198955036695', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 612, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 213, 'last_played': 1694992355}
review: This game is pretty good! It's a port of the Playstation 2 Asobo version and even though I like the Xbox 360 Heavy Iron version more I still enjoyed this game! The graphics are also really nice to me, during cutscenes you see a drop in quality but that's because they are videos and aren't playing out in game so I don't really mind it. For a licensed game this is excellent! But I do have a few complaints. The game drags on for way too long and so do levels, making the game get really repetitive after a while. The controls on PC kinda suck especially during the EVE missions but an easy fix is to just use a controller if you have one because luckily this game has controller support. This game is not worth 20 dollars but I recommend getting it when it is on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198131252662', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 289, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 284, 'last_played': 1675413715}
review:
Decent licensed game co-developed by Heavy Iron, who were responsible for the original Battle for Bikini Bottom.
Platforming levels are fun, with a focus on momentum-based traversal and puzzle-solving, but nearly half of the levels are brain-dead auto-scrollers where you just fire a laser at things or push forward. It is a game aimed at kids and made on the cheap, so I guess it's excusable.

Despite this being a fairly old PC port, I encountered no major technical issues playing it on a Windows 10 PC. However, the game's frame rate is uncapped and there's no V-Sync option in the game's config, so if you want a stable frame rate, you'll need to set V-Sync to Always On in your GPU control panel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198422199704', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 431, 'playtime_forever': 689, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 689, 'last_played': 1608815177}
review:
Wall-E is still the best 3D anime Movie in my Heart even up till now. And this game, even though i played it long ago, still makes me gone and grab it here on steam out of nostalgia... But i glad i did... :3

This game is a lot more difficult than i remember, but it's rewarding. The story goes a little before Axiom took off to space and all the way to After the ending of the movie. Yes, we get to see what happen after the ending.

The game is aged however, so the cinematic and game textures turned up blurry. But still, even with those blur, this is still a great game with great story to tell. Even if you didn't watch the movie, the game covers enough to let you enjoy from the start to the end.

Honestly speaking, some changes in the game makes the whole Wall-E story more logical and exciting compared to the Movie. So those who watch the movie before will still be able to enjoy this game in a new perspective. But be warned.. it does require some skill to clear the game.. if you don't like extreme Parkour genre, this game might makes you cry.. :3

Skills required to clear this game:
[1] Puzzle solving
[2] Shooter (Shooting Genre)
[3] Parkour (Platforming + Time Limited Racing)
[4] Flight Navigating
[5] Road Crossing/River Crossing/Chicken Crossing

author: {'steamid': '76561198323588630', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 478, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 360, 'last_played': 1679772153}
review:
Great movie adaptation! You will certainly enjoy it if you have played the game or loved the movie when you were a kid. I had a blast playing through it again.
The video game adaptation of Wall E is a 3D game with mainly puzzle and parkour elements. As it mostly follows the plot of the movie, I would recommend watching the movie before you play the game. For a game from 2008 the graphics aged quite well. The music is appropriately used although the music itself is not that interesting. Except the songs from "Hello, Dolly !" which were used in the movie too, those were great and can stand on their own. The level design is good and has some really creative game mechanics. The game feels great when using a controller although I've heard that MKB controls aren't that great. 
Completing the game (not 100%) took me just 6 hours and considering the short length, the regular price (15 euros) seems quite steep.
I really recommend this game if you have good memories playing it when you were young or if you loved the movie. If not, it might still be worth the 15 euros if you are looking for a relatively easy 3D puzzle/parkour game.

author: {'steamid': '76561199055242516', 'num_games_owned': 22, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 616, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 616, 'last_played': 1605555578}
review:
7 years later, and it is still a masterpiece. I mean, why else would I come back to a game with outdated graphics and repetitive SFX after 10 years and ACTUALLY buy it?

I've 100%-ed the game in about 10 hours, and I really liked it, like, REALLY.
The music is a music to my ears, the graphics were outstanding back then, all levels are quite enjoyable (except Eve's Pursuit, f#ck THAT), the multiplayer is what I am to this day is fascinated by. I WILL recommend it, and the price is worth it. 

Good luck for now. Peace.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036551982', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 39, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1605500314}
review:
Although I dislike the game, mostly because I played the PS3 version a while back, I do think this is a good game objectively.

In of itself, the controls are a bit wonky to get used to, but they are alright and actually end up being quite smooth once you get that muscle memory for different things.

I'd personally recommend the PS3 or XBOX 360 version (even if you have to play on an emulator), but if it's unavailable this will provide a fitting substitute.

author: {'steamid': '76561198411934155', 'num_games_owned': 210, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 2289, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 932, 'last_played': 1653432173}
review:
Firstly, this game is my childhood. WALL-E was (and still is) my favorite movie of all time. I had this on my PS2 and it was definitely my most played game on that system, I had so much fun with it. So hearing that it was ported to Steam sounded like a dream come true.

However, in my opinion, the Steam port is less than optimal. Keyboard controls could be much better. For example, the button to play music (which is a crucial function in the main story) is mapped to Y, and must be held down to work. And the E, Q, and X buttons do nothing, so it could have easily been mapped to one of those. But this is just one example of this.

I think it is a very significant flaw. In my first runthrough of this version, I decided to push past it for nostalgia. But now I'd like to try and 100% it, and I just can't bring myself to do so. 

If you're willing to let it go for a nostalgia rush, or if you just enjoy the movie and wish to experience this, by all means do so. It's a relatively solid game otherwise. The controls could simply be much better.

EDIT: For best experience, use a controller to play this game. The controls are much more optimized for it, and it will make it much more fun.

EDIT 2: I've now been informed that it is possible to change the control scheme by going to the game folder, running GameSetup.exe, and changing the settings from there. While I'm glad there is a way to change it, I feel that the control scheme could have been handled much better by default.

review: Definitely worth checking out. The graphics are a little old but the game holds up till today. It's a big nostalgia trip and a fun time even for new players. author: {'steamid': '76561198001779896', 'num_games_owned': 1487, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 1443, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1385, 'last_played': 1596500464}
review:
Have fun playing as a sentient garbage truck in a kid-friendly sci-fi story with an opinion on climate change! Based on the Disney-Pixar film, [i]WALL‚Ä¢E[/i] the game lets you become the last remaining Waste Allocation Load Lifter Earth-Class robot on the planet. Like the movie, WALL‚Ä¢E navigates through a deserted, trash-filled world crushing garbage into small cubes, all the while developing child-like traits beyond its programming, such as curiosity and joy.

The game incorporates WALL‚Ä¢E's cubes‚Äîas well as his built-in laser beam, music player and solar panel‚Äîas puzzle game mechanics to traverse the harsh environment. The good folks at Buy N Large (the mega-retailer safeguarding humanity until life can thrive again) have left other cubes lying around the wasteland, the contents of which help WALL‚Ä¢E open doors, recharge his batteries, and replenish his laser. The plot thickens with the arrival of EVE, a sleek, curvy floating droid that lands on WALL‚Ä¢E's doorstep via space rocket.

The developers of [i]WALL‚Ä¢E[/i] did a great job sticking to the movie's visual style, as well as the broad strokes of its plot, while forging their own parallel storyline. Part of game's charm is the light touches of humor scattered throughout. Remember that montage in the movie where WALL‚Ä¢E collects human junk found in the trash and misinterprets its original use? The game turns that into a treasure hunt within each level. Collect all the hidden artifacts and you win points tradeable for cheat codes and bonus materials, but also you get rewarded with cutesy skits of WALL‚Ä¢E playing with the objects.

The game's elements are neither original nor very challenging, but together they make an engaging experience. Roguelike fans should steer away from this casual and very forgiving third-person 3D action game for kids. Low difficulty aside, I got a kick out of how the game pays homage to different games and genres. Racers, skateboard sims, stealth games, rail shooters, color pattern memory games, flight sims, even [i]Frogger[/i] of all things. My biggest surprise playing [i]WALL‚Ä¢E[/i], 10 years after purchasing it for my kid, is how good the in-game graphics look in modern resolutions like 1080p and 4K.

Which brings me to the most notable flaw in [i]WALL‚Ä¢E[/i] the video game, which are the cutscenes. While the in-game ones look fantastic, the ones between levels are video files in NTSC format, an image resolution lower than that of DVD movies. Guess how crappy those scenes look blown up to 1080p. In addition, you cannot skip them unless you finish and replay a level, which annoys me to no end. Also, while the game uses clips and sound design from the movie to  to great effect, they actually got the great Jeff Garlin to reprise his role as the Captain of the Axiom ... and made him phone in his performance! What gives?

Still, I enjoyed playing [i]WALL‚Ä¢E[/i] very much, in case this wasn't abundantly clear. Movie tie-in games usually get a bad rap for falling somewhere between a well-intentioned mess an a senseless cash grab. Every assumes games based on a licensed intellectual property only cater to fans of said IP. (Statistically, most of them do suck!) Fortunately, [i]WALL‚Ä¢E[/i] counts as a pleasant exception worthy of the 6-8 hours you'll breeze through to complete it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198335171788', 'num_games_owned': 425, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 421, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 356, 'last_played': 1701501992}
review:
First of all, I played this game as a kid on Play Station 2.
This was one of my childhood games after I finally got a PS2 one Christmas.
Wall-E came bundled with the console and I absolutely loved the game!

Now, this games controls are absolutely shocking, but like it was the same on PS2, nothing will change. 
Graphics are kinda dated too but if you want a solid Disney experience and in my opinion the best game from a Disney movie then this is it.

I got 5 hours of gameplay for the whole playthrough and enjoyed every minute. Time may vary cause the game does have bad controls and I found myself wanting to find glitches and cool spots through the maps. There is also lot's of replayability due to the little cheats menu and extra's menu and there is also multiplayer although I don't know how good that would be cause I haven't played it.

It is a little dare, but I reckon I enjoyed it for the price and will be back for nostalgic reasons. Have some childhood fun and just play it! Would totally recommend!

author: {'steamid': '76561198178480001', 'num_games_owned': 666, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 272, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 154, 'last_played': 1671771088}
review:
Disney‚Ä¢Pixar WALL-E: The Video Game is an experience, and a joyful one at that. I bought Disney‚Ä¢Pixar WALL-E: The Video Game because I had it on the Nintendo Wii in 2008. After recently selling my Nintendo Wii, along with my games for it, I realized I never completed Disney‚Ä¢Pixar WALL-E: The Video Game, yet had made a promise to myself that I would complete Disney‚Ä¢Pixar WALL-E: The Video Game in the future. And the future is now. After buying Disney‚Ä¢Pixar WALL-E: The Video Game on Steam for approximately twenty United States dollars, I loaded up the game, only to be filled with a sense of pure nostalgia. The flashy musical intro, with the song "Put on Your Sunday Clothes" from "Hello Dolly", the song that repeats throughout the film, alongside the visuals of the blueprints for the various machinery in the WALL-E universe, was a joy to see once more. After playing though the tutorial of the game once more, I came under the realization that Disney‚Ä¢Pixar WALL-E: The Video Game's mechanics are like no other I have ever come across. Disney‚Ä¢Pixar WALL-E: The Video Game uses gameplay ideas and mechanics that no other games have dared to attempt the way they have. In order to make certain jumps throughout the game, you must gain momentum, in order to reach said heights. However, gaining momentum in order to make jumps and flips on half-pipes, it does not feel like a Sonic the Hedgehog game, because unlike a Sonic the Hedgehog game, Disney‚Ä¢Pixar WALL-E: The Video Game works outstandingly well in 3D. Jumping aside, the variety of different gameplay in Disney‚Ä¢Pixar WALL-E: The Video Game is outstanding. There are some parts of Disney‚Ä¢Pixar WALL-E: The Video Game where you seek out required materials, some where you get to fly as the drone "EVE" and blast objects in the way with her cannon arm, and there are even sections where you can see through WALL-E's perspective with a laser of his own, making this game a first person shooter. WALL-E himself has a variety of abilities, such as picking up blocks of dirt, being a clever reference to Disney‚Ä¢Pixar WALL-E (The Movie). I do not wish to spoil much of Disney‚Ä¢Pixar WALL-E: The Video Game, because I urge you to go out and play this game, and realize for yourself the vast gameplay you can find in Disney‚Ä¢Pixar WALL-E: The Video Game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198194911018', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1804, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 536, 'last_played': 1706750401}
review: I would recommend this game in a heartbeat. I was obsessed with the movie as a kid and loved the game when the movie was out. It played a special role in my childhood just like Spyro did. I love platformers in gaming and this one made for a great platformer. Although it's not my favorite video game ever made, it is most definitely my favorite movie video game tie in. I prefer the PS2/PSP/PC versions of this game over the PS3/360/Wii and DS versions of this game. Are you a Pixar fan? Do you love this movie? Do you love movie video game tie ins? If the answer to any of these questions is a yes, then definitely play this game. It's actually a lot of fun. And the graphics are surprisingly good for a ps2 game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060434019', 'num_games_owned': 2386, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 635, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 624, 'last_played': 1598452430}
review:
7/10


Graphics
‚òê Beautiful
‚òê Average
‚òë Outdated (Very muddy textures in some places)
 
Gameplay
‚òë Fun
‚òê Average
‚òê Repetitive   

Audio
‚òê High quality
‚òê Average 
‚òë Low 

Difficulty
‚òê Hard
‚òê Average
‚òë Easy

Story
‚òë Great (Fits together better than the movie in my opinion)
‚òêAverage
‚òê Low quality

Bugs
‚òê None that i came across
‚òë A couple (namely vaulting sometimes bugs out)
‚òê Gamebreaking Bugs

Summery
Quite a charming game, i played this first on the psp back in the late 2000's, It's actually not that much different than the pc version, minus a couple of levels. 
The Games' Story seemed to fit better as a narrative than the actual movie itself which is interesting, not many games that are licensed by movies seem to end up like this, so nice to see.
in terms of graphics, dont expect anything better than ps2 era, its VERY low quality in pretty much every asset apart from eva, wall-e and a few other items, in terms of texture maps, they look like bald textures in some places, lacking any sort of 'texture' ironically.
Gameplay is really what i came for, which i enjoyed, works much better with the mouse input, though it's designed for console, so makes some sections ludicrously easy, 
(though i guess it is aimed at younger children).
i would say worth a playthrough, i liked some of the licensed games from this era, 2007-2012 they had a certain charm not found in modern games, that clinically arcade feel which has been lost to realism.

Sometimes its fun to sit back and play a game that doesn't try to hard to take itself seriously.

author: {'steamid': '76561198170435999', 'num_games_owned': 84, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 667, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 180, 'last_played': 1657812115}
review:
I decided to pay the full 20$ for this game, for the nostalgia and everything, and at first I was disappointed. This game is NOT meant for PC, I repeat NOT. It may have the controls and optimization for pc but it was not built to work with pc controls.
That being said if you do not own a controller that you can hook with steam and play games like this with, do not get it.
The game has aged pretty well, some areas have a design and soundtrack that make it almost timeless, others do not and sometimes bug out. Like on the Axiom, there were times where the gravity cubes would bug out and clip through the wall, this means I was not able to complete the puzzle and would have to restart. 
Another time I'd notice that you could see through certain parts of the maps or notice missing textures in cutscenes behind things that normally outside of the cutscene you would not be able to see.
Otherwise, for what this game was back when ps2/xbox 360 were the big things, this game was absolutely one of the best titles you could get for a kid, and I'd still recommend it for a gift to a younger kid who would appreciate the love and care that was put into this game.
9/10 would play for 100 more hours lol

review: This game is a very fun version of WALL-E the movie. It lets you play through your favorite scenes as WALL-E and EVE. My grandson bought me this game because WALL-E is my favorite movie. I got a Steam account just for this (please ignore my 400 other games, those are my grandson's). I really loved the part where WALL-E becomes Frogger. It was really fun but I wish it lasted longer. The multiplayer is also amazing. I played it with my grandson yesterday and he said it was "space aids." I'm not sure what that means but I think it's slang for something really cool and fun. Please let me know in the comments if you know what it means. I love WALL-E and Pixar and John Lasseter!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198014018551', 'num_games_owned': 232, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 601, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 507, 'last_played': 1661744404}
review: I had this game as a kid on the Playstation 2, I was feeling nostalgic and decided to pick up the PC version on Steam.  Was not disappointed.  Great controls that really fit how Wall-E's designed as a robot.  There were many good puzzles, nothing too complicated.  Plenty of secrets.  Some jumps were a bit unforgiving, but that's fine, as it was only a small few of them, the rest were great.  The story was pretty faithful to the movie, aside from one instance of a deleted scene being used instead of the actual one seen in the movie.  Overall, great game.  Definitely a must have purchase for fans of both puzzle-platformers and the Wall-E movie.

review: A pure nostalgia ride. Played the game religiously as a little kid and it is just like I remember. Beyond even the nostalgia the game is fun with good gameplay and enjoyable level design. Short and sweet with me taking 1.7 hours to get halfway through. However, hard to recommend at $20 if you did not play it as a child and won't experience the nostalgia. Overall, the perfect game.

review: Hands down one of the best video games ever made. The sheer quality of the missions alone should show you how much thought and love has been put into constructing this digital world. Each location has a distinct feeling and style, which provides to the overall experience. With a superb cast of characters and a oscar-worthy soundtrack, this is an instant buy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055641699', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 766, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 352, 'last_played': 1691975446}
review:
This game is my childhood, I love it.

This is a very good game and the best of the 4 WALL-E video games. It's a pretty good platformer that follows the events of the movie with minor changes here and there. There are a decent amount of simple puzzles in the game in the form of door panels, nothing too hard just simple minigames. The game also has pretty good music. Overall it's a fun game that I played a lot as kid.

review:
I have no previous nostalgia for this game and still found it to be enjoyable. I finished it in around 4 hours and during that time I experienced a good variety of game play, with many optional secrets to find if I wanted.
The rest of my recorded steam time is from when I handed the game to my 4 year old...this is easily his favourite game. Would highly recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198126907300', 'num_games_owned': 258, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1930, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 729, 'last_played': 1590350217}
review: Wall-e is not any kind of game, it's a game that truly makes you question how you didn't find this game sooner, it gives a completely new meaning to video games, with the amazing graphics, amazing story and amazing smooth gameplay. There really isn't a better game than Wall-e. Wall-e answers the questions like: What is the meaning of life?, What happens after death?, Is life real?, Why does dad hit me? Etc. It really is something special... You really wouldn't think that it's that much of a special game at first glance but when you play it you realize more and more how fantastic the game actually is... The only con is that people might make fun of you because it's a "kids game", but they aren't real friends anyways, right? So I would 100% recommend this game to anyone who seeks for the most amazing and fascinating game on this platform. It truly is something special and I think that everyone should experience this amazing experience that Wall-e will give you.

review:
I don't want to fault this game - it's a charming game based on an equally memorable movie and character, and that alone is rare, BUT, for anyone who was wondering, this is the PS2/Wii port of the game, NOT the higher-def X360/PS3 version that was released soon after.

It's still a very playable, easy trip down memory lane, and impressive to see the quality isn't too diluted when bumped up from 800 x 600 to modern widescreen.

review:
Stara, ale nie wyglƒÖda jako≈õ szczeg√≥lnie ≈∫le... Znaczy, ziemia jako taka porzucona i zanieczyszczona pasuje jak najbardziej, ale Aksjomat (czy jak mu tam) wyglƒÖda co najmniej do≈õƒá... Specyficznie. Ale ja siƒô bawi≈Çem dobrze. Oprawa audio w porzƒÖdku.

Wiele rzeczy mog≈Çoby byƒá zrobionych lepiej, ale jak na tamte czasy to nie ma co narzekaƒá.

Przedstawia to historiƒô innƒÖ ni≈º poznanƒÖ w filmie, ciekawostka - widzimy bardziej "pierwotnƒÖ" wersjƒô fabu≈Çy (pomijajƒÖc skakanie po r√≥≈ºnych przeszkodach, nad przepa≈õciami etc. oraz "misje dodatkowe")

Proszƒô mieƒá na uwadze, ≈ºe gra jest stara. Nawet bardzo stara. Nie ma aktualizacji, dalszego rozwoju i innych "standardowych" rzeczy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005057754', 'num_games_owned': 1275, 'num_reviews': 119, 'playtime_forever': 577, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 577, 'last_played': 1523034011}
review:
I must be officially old, because I'm waxing nostalgic over a game based off a movie that I loved when I was 18.  Ah, well.

WALL-E had a lot of official games when it came out.  This one is the PC version, which is apparently the same as the PS2 version and maybe the PSP version (if the rumors I heard were correct).   It follows the movie for the most part, although it has two major differences: [spoiler]a sequence at the beginning where WALL-E thinks he's found another functioning WALL-E robot[/spoiler] and [spoiler]AUTO electrocuting EVE instead of WALL-E, which fun fact was originally going to be how the movie went but they changed it at the last minute[/spoiler].  Yes, I spoilered it.  Screw you.  But anyway, yeah, if you've seen WALL-E, you know what to expect storywise pretty much.

The gameplay itself is...not the worst I've ever seen in a licensed game.  In fact, I'd say it's pretty good even, once you get the keys bound right or use a controller.  Mouselook is impossible here, don't even try.  Seriously.  Anyway, it's a 3D platformer/puzzle game, with some shooting minigames and Frogger clones for good measure.  Combat is laughably easy, provided you just box form everything to death.  The puzzles are fun, and vaguely remind me of Portal at times (it's because of all the robots and cubes).  Graphics are pretty good, and the robot models all look good (the humans are another story).  Soundtrack is nowhere near as beatiful as the movie's, but it has some great tunes (the one that plays during speedway sections comes to mind).  The little animations that play whenever WALL-E finds an artifact are the cutest thing ever.

All in all, I might be blinded by nostalgia here, but this is one of the better licensed games I've played.  I'd even say that it stands pretty well on its own.   10/10, would watch two robots fling a ski mask at each other again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198453513261', 'num_games_owned': 114, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 1943, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 578, 'last_played': 1689463386}
review:
I got this game on sale for like 5 bucks, and it's AWESOME. I had the console version of this, as well as the PC demo when I was younger, so I decided, "why not"? I was not disappointed. The controls were kind of weird to get used to at first, but I got the hang of it. It's charming and cute, but action-packed at the same time. I definitely recommend picking this one up if it's on sale, or even if it's not. If you're a completionist and would want to beat this 100%, I genuinely wish you the best of luck. Seriously.

TL;DR, Got it on sale for 5 dabloons, loved it to death, controls were slightly weird, 100 percenting is stupidly hard, stop reading this and buy the freaking game already.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093268594', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 482, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 393, 'last_played': 1519700300}
review:
Put on your Sunday clothes, for its a nostalgic review.

Wall-E is and will always be my favourite Disney movie. When I was a kid back in 2008. I remember seeing the movie on my birthday and I remember becoming obsessed over it, so it was only natural that the game would fall into my hands. I got a Wall-E action figure, which still one of my prized possessions today, and I am writing this review with it by my side. I remember at the time I used to hum and sing the Hello, Dolly songs from the movie all of the time. Even though I only knew the segments that were in the movie/game. But as time went on and my young mind moved onto other things, the my disk copies of the movie and this game fell into oblivion. I only just remembered within the last two months that this game existed. I remembered the great and frustrating times I've had with this game on my old Windows XP. And now in December of 2017, as an young adult, I finally returned to this game to write my nostalgic review.

Wall-E the video game is predominately a puzzle solving platformer style game, with some racing style stages and rail shooter mixed in. The game has a similar storyline to that of the movie, but with some divergences. Between each chapter there is a cut scene, which is basically a shortened/simplified version of what happened in the movie. Of course, in these types of games you do inevitably get the, ‚Äòwhat the hell do i do‚Äô kind of moments. I remember as a kid spending what seem to be constant hours of prostration wondering what I should do, or trying to do that one jump, but in my new play through I didn't have nearly as much problems. But as a kid I never read the instructions, so that explains a lot. 

It was and still is always a joy to hear the Hello, Dolly music every time I boot up the game, complete a chapter, and watch the credits, along with the games original soundtrack, which is unique to the game, but the soundtrack is not quite as impressive as I remember it to be. Also I found a quite surprisingly that in the credits of the game, every single musician involved in the making of the original soundtrack is credited in the credits under the instrument that they played. Though in the movie they used the version from the original 1969 Hello, Dolly movie, but in the game they use a reproduction version. A minor issue that I disapprove of. 

Surprisingly to my adult self, the game isn't a complete and utter cash grab as I thought it was. A lot of time, effort, and content, has actually been put into the game. The main storyline took me roughly 6 hours to complete with some quite well designed and diverse stages. Heck, Wall-E the video game from 2008 has more content then the latest 2017 EA games.

I also like how the game has some after the credits stages, with Earth being colonised. The stages you saw at the start of the game are now green and lush, but crawling with enemies. There is also such a stage that takes place inside the Axiom as well. All something which I thought was a really nice feature, considering that we only have the ending credits of the movie to guess what happened. But is the video game ending technically cannon?

The game is not incredibly difficult to complete. But it's a kids game, what do you expect? 

Unlike other older games on Windows 10 like Rome Total War and Fallout III, Wall-E starts up and runs perfectly well on Windows 10. No fiddling around with game files required. And the game at self is bug free. Only once I had to restart a chapter because of an one off issue with the level design.

Just like in the movie, Wall-E has a cassette player that plays Put on your Sunday Clothes. The cassette player is used to call/attract Reject robots to follow and to complete tasks, which is necessary to complete some chapters. This is definitely a really nice feature, but it would be great if you didn't have to hold Y all the time to play the cassette player

Now on to the negatives. 

Wall-E normally costs twenty NZD, which for such an old game is very much overpriced. I got my steam copy for six NZD during the winter sale, which is far more reasonable. So only buy this game when it is on sale.

When you boot up the game for the very first time, a menu will pop up; a menu which is similar to the ones you see when you start up some unity games. At the time I wasn't aware of this, but it was a sort of an installation menu. This is the only menu in the game where you can adjust the resolution of the game. Because this game is made in the pre-wide screen days, unless you adjust the resolution, the game will look kind of stretched on modern screens, but the game was never meant to be graphically stunning anyway. So I think it is a necessary step when playing older games like Wall-E, to adjust the resolution accordingly. But once you press play on that menu you cannot open it up again, and no, you cannot adjust the resolution in the games options. You can only adjust sound and sensitivity in the options menu. 

There is only four chapters in the main storyline where you get to play as Eve and all of those chapters are flying/timed races style stages. On none of the regular chapters can you play as Eve. I didn't think this was a problem when I was a kid, but looking back on it as an young adult it kind of is. She as an laser gun in her arm for crying out loud. In the cutscenes she can one shot the police robots. While I'm sitting there trying to deal with all the police robots. Just metres away, Eve is just standing there waiting for me to complete the puzzle and open the door. There is only one stage near the end of the game that is not in a cutscene, where you can see her actively flying around and gunning down enemies. Just something I thought while playing the game.

The Games camera, which is controlled via the mouse, can be really annoying inside tight spaces, especially when enemies at nearby. So the camera can be super annoying sometimes. 

But overall, apart from some other minor issues. Wall-E the video game is actually quite a good and enjoyable game, especially if your playing for nostalgia sake. Again, only buy when on sale. I would give Wall-E a seven out of ten and a nostalgic seal of approval.

author: {'steamid': '76561198373847005', 'num_games_owned': 414, 'num_reviews': 153, 'playtime_forever': 639, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 439, 'last_played': 1574222575}
review:
Wall-E 
One of my favourite games i had when i was younger
its still as fun as i remember, i still get that nostalgic feeling 
10/10
now for a in-depth review

PRO's
-Sound Effects and Music are Spot on
-Collectibles and Rewards are really cool (buying concept art for destroying crates and finding a rubber ducky)
-Levels (these were a bit challenging as a kid but not anymore, but they were fun, the only level i hated was flying with eve on earth[without a controller] )
-Comedy is perfect for a children‚Äôs game (which it is)
-Npc's look the best look fucking hilarious [http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1211881772](im one of those who dont care about how it looks just how fun it is)
-Mechanics are Useful and creative (like robots, putting your music on will interact with them, hey it is good music)
-Story (isn‚Äôt the same which makes it a bit better, had to shake it up a bit, and it wouldn‚Äôt make sense)
-its just really fun

CON'S
-wish it had all ports available, i never had it on DS and apparently, there was more places to explore as in open world.

10/10

review:
Jumping is broken; it makes every single jump an exercise in frustration because you are just as likely to fall as land on your target platform.   
It seems to be a feature because jumping is gimped normally except when you are at the edge of a platform, but the game doesnt seem to understand I am actually trying to jump across something performing the most pathetic hop instead, either falling to your death or further back down the level causing you to renavigate sections repeatedly.
